message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CE, cs.DC, cs.SY 

The paper proposes a hybrid approach that combines machine learning (Gaussian Processes) with a process-based model (Noah land-surface model) to simulate soil moisture. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves modeling and simulation of physical systems, which could fall under the Computational Engineering (cs.CE) and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes a path for building global land-surface models, which could be relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
